style.name: Pumpkin Beer
style.description: Pumpkin beers are any beers using pumpkins (Cucurbito pepo) as an adjunct in either mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation, providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, qualities. Pumpkin qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. These may or may not be spiced or flavored with other things. A statement by the brewer explaining the nature of the beer is essential for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with pumpkin, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: Motor City Pumpkin Ale is a special combination of oven roasted Detroit grown pumpkins and spices, along with a traditional Belgium yeast for a wonderful rich, earth and spicy undertone.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Herb and Spice Beer
style.description: Herb beers use herbs or spices (derived from roots, seeds, fruits, vegetable, flowers, etc.) other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character, though individual characters of herbs and/or spices used may not always be identifiable. Under hopping often, but not always, allows the spice or herb to contribute to the flavor profile. Positive evaluations are significantly based on perceived balance of flavors. Note: Chili-flavored beers that emphasize heat rather than chili flavor should be entered as a "spiced" beer.  A statement by the brewer explaining what herbs or spices are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. Specifying a style upon which the beer is based may help evaluation. If this beer is a classic style with an herb or spice, the brewer should specify the classic style. If no Chocolate or Coffee category exists in a competition, then chocolate and coffee beers should be entered in this category.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: Southampton Pumpkin Ale is an unique amber-colored brew that has particular appeal during the autumn months and the holidays of Halloween and Thanksgiving. We use a generous amount of pumpkin as well as traditional "pumpkin pie" spices to give this unusual brew a definite seasonal character. Available in 22oz bottles and seasonal draft.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description:
This special beer is brewed for the best season of the year. It’s color resembles the falling leaves and the aroma and flavor will transport your senses to autumn. Brewed with a variety of spices and dry-spiced for additional character.

It is like pumpkin pie in a glass without the curst and whipped cream.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: Brewed once a year from locally grown pie pumpkins harvested at Moses Farm in Eagle Bridge, NY, this sturdy ale truly satisfies all the senses. It pours a lovely mahogany-bronze color with just a hint of orange that is complemented by a rich, warm aroma not unlike fresh baked pumpkin pie. Munich malt provides the perfect balance to the sweet pumpkin and spice flavors, giving it rich malty-sweet flavor that finishes dry and clean.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: Unlike most pumpkin beers, we make this with real pumpkin! We add pumpkin throughout the boil giving it a rich, underlying sweetness and flavor. Then finish with our blend of seasonal spices to make this beer the perfect blend of a beer and pumpkin. This brew is perfect for those delightful autumn evenings!

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: In the fall of 2004 we created a Pumpkin Ale at the request of the Town of Windsor's  Pumpkin Festival and a fall classic was born. We brew this ale using Howard Dill's® world famous Atlantic Giant Pumpkins® with a special blend of spices - this of course in addition to the usual ingredients: highest quality malted grains, hops, water and yeast. It’s the next best thing to pumpkin pie. This one goes fast so make sure you mark your calendar for this October.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: Fall brings out the best in in nature. Almost overnight trees that looked acceptable in their majestic coats of green, now don the brazen hues of brass, gold and burnt crimsons. Thanksgiving is perhaps the best of holidays, for it is a time for sharing and enriching our lives. To honor Fall we offer our deep mahogany hued Pumpkin Ale, bursting with a robust roasted malt flavor. To this mélange we add copious amounts of pumpkin and embellish that further with nutmeg, cinnamon and ginger. This would have been ideal, but perfection is our preference and so we diligently add cocoa nibs as the beer conditions and intensifies the depth of flavor. This melds magnificently with the pumpkin and spice. And as a fitting finale we gently introduce hops to compliment this complex potion and the result is a finish that is clean and brilliant. Perfect for Fall and the approaching holiday season.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description:
This is the perfect beer to drink as the weather starts to turn a bit cooler.  Brewed with pureed pumpkins added directly to the mash, and traditional pumpkin pie spices add to the end of the boil, this beer packs a ton of flavor into a malty and smooth amber colored ale.

Loaded with the aromas of fall, and Pumpkin Pie, of course.  Pumpkin, cinnomin, nutmeg and allspice dominate the flavor profile, with the hops playing in the background.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: We make a smaller version of our barleywine and add cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, and ginger to it for a decadent seasonal treat.  Aromas of pumpkin spice abound in this medium bodied, malt forward beer.

data.name: Pumpkin Ale
data.description: In our pursuit to bring you the most flavourful and unique beers possible, we are proud to release this tasty autumn ale. Handcrafted with an assortment of specialty malts and hops, we added a generous amount of pumpkin directly into the brew. Combine this with hints of cinnamon, clove, nutmeg and allspice, and you’ve got a beer that you won’t soon forget. Rich, satisfying and slightly spicy, our seasonal ale goes perfectly with your favourite dessert or traditional feast. But like fall, Pumpkin Ale comes but once a year!
data.foodPairings: Thanksgiving dinner, pumpkin pie, candy, walnuts.

style.description: Pumpkin beers are any beers using pumpkins (Cucurbito pepo) as an adjunct in either mash, kettle, primary or secondary fermentation, providing obvious (ranging from subtle to intense), yet harmonious, qualities. Pumpkin qualities should not be overpowered by hop character. These may or may not be spiced or flavored with other things. A statement by the brewer explaining the nature of the beer is essential for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with pumpkin, the brewer should also specify the classic style.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Herb and Spice Beer
style.description: Herb beers use herbs or spices (derived from roots, seeds, fruits, vegetable, flowers, etc.) other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character, though individual characters of herbs and/or spices used may not always be identifiable. Under hopping often, but not always, allows the spice or herb to contribute to the flavor profile. Positive evaluations are significantly based on perceived balance of flavors. Note: Chili-flavored beers that emphasize heat rather than chili flavor should be entered as a "spiced" beer.  A statement by the brewer explaining what herbs or spices are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. Specifying a style upon which the beer is based may help evaluation. If this beer is a classic style with an herb or spice, the brewer should specify the classic style. If no Chocolate or Coffee category exists in a competition, then chocolate and coffee beers should be entered in this category.

data.name: Pumpkin Ball Imperial Pumpkin
data.description: This Imperial Pumpkin uses over 100 pounds of fresh pumpkin and just a touch of spices.

data.name: Pumpkin Bamberg
data.description: With the balance of smoke and malt from Old Bamberg, Pumpkin Bamberg offers an added layer of pumpkin during the holiday season.
data.foodPairings: Pairs well with Thanksgiving dinner or by itself on a cold, fall evening.

style.name: American-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: American style barley wines range from amber to deep copper-garnet in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by assertive bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor are at medium to very high levels. American type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Very low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. A caramel and/or toffee aroma and flavor are often part of the character. Characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, are not generally acceptable in American-style Barley Wine Ale, however if a low level of age-induced oxidation character harmonizes and enhances the overall experience this can be regarded favorably. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

style.name: Fruit Cider
style.description: Like a dry wine with complex flavors. The apple character must marry with the added fruit so that neither dominates the other.

data.name: Pumpkin Blend
data.description:
Get it while it lasts.
With a very short window of availability, Pumpkin Blend is made by adding fresh pumpkin mash to the apple press, highlighted by seasonal chai spices. Available early September through Halloween, this creation will have you ready for the falling foliage and shifting seasons.

available.name: Fall
available.description: Available during the fall months.

style.name: Fruit Cider
style.description: Like a dry wine with complex flavors. The apple character must marry with the added fruit so that neither dominates the other.

style.name: Specialty Honey Lager or Ale
style.description: These beers are brewed using honey in addition to malted barley. Beers may be brewed to a traditional style or may be experimental. Character of honey should be evident in flavor and aroma and balanced with the other components without overpowering them. A statement by the brewer explaining the classic or other style of the beer, and the type of honey used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions.

style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier
style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.

data.name: Pumpkin Bret
data.description: A fall seasonal, this is our pumpkin ale funked up a bit with a special Bret blend from East Coast Yeast. For the sour fans among us...
